creator: jtdoz6+apache@gmail.com
text:
The default Internal Server Error message that is hard-coded into httpd should probably be reevaluated.

The line in question currently says, "Please contact the server administrator, some@email.com and inform them of the time the error occurred, and anything you might have done that may have caused the error."

This message has a couple of grammar bugs and some would say has an accusatory tone. My suggestion would be to change it to something like, "Please contact the server administrator at some@email.com to inform them of the time the error occurred and the actions you performed that resulted in this error."

Additionally, including the server time on the page could prove beneficial to sysadmins as they are tracking down log entries.

Sorry to reopen. One more nitpick. The patch changes the text to "Please contact the server administrator at some@email.com, and inform them of the time this error occurred,and the actions you performed which led to this error."

Those commas are not unnecessary and having 'and' twice so close together is kind of awkward. I'd suggest removing the first comma, changing the first 'and' to 'to', and replacing the last comma with a space. Altogether, that would read

Please contact the server administrator at some@email.com to inform them of the time this error occurred and the actions you performed which led to this error.
